creditline: Gift of Joel L. Cohen in memory of Kermit A. Brandt, Class of 1956

makers.displaydate: 1840–1930; born Chicago, IL; died Dousman, WI; active Chicago and Edgerton, WI
makers.displaymaker: Pauline Jacobus, 1840–1930; born Chicago, IL; died Dousman, WI; active Chicago and Edgerton, WI

texts.textentryhtml: The artist; given to Mr. Thompson, Edgerton, Wisconsin, ca. 1902–03; by descent to his daughter, Leo Thompson, Edgerton, Wisconsin; Virginia and Paul Hughes, Whitewater, Wisconsin; Lorrie and Gerry Millette, Fort Atkinson, WI, from 1993; Joel L. Cohen and Kermit A. Brandt, Class of 1956, Chicago, Illinois; given to the Princeton University Art Museum, November 2023.

displaymaker: Pauline Jacobus, 1840–1930; born Chicago, IL; died Dousman, WI; active Chicago and Edgerton, WI
caption: Pauline Jacobus (1840–1930; born Chicago, IL; died Dousman, WI; active Chicago and Edgerton, WI), Ewer, ca. 1902–3. Earthenware; 35.6 × 25.4 × 20.3 cm. Gift of Joel L. Cohen in memory of Kermit A. Brandt, Class of 1956 (2023-297)
